solution_line_template: At a rate of {plow_rate} acres per day, he can plow his {farmland_acres} acres of farmland in {farmland_acres}/{plow_rate}=<<{farmland_acres}/{plow_rate}={plow_days}>>{plow_days} days.
At a rate of {mow_rate} acres per day, he can mow his {grassland_acres} acres of grassland in {grassland_acres}/{mow_rate}={mow_days} days.
Altogether, it would take him {plow_days}+{mow_days}=<<{plow_days}+{mow_days}={total_days}>>{total_days} days to completely mow and plow his land.
